result.execSummary:
Leon C. Anderson Jr. was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Leon C. Anderson Jr. was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leon C. Anderson Jr.

records.addlTxt: CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY: Kaitlin Dippolito &  Abrianna Dolfi   DF:  Leon C. Anderson appeared from jail via video. DE has received a copy of the extradition paperwork. Address and DOB confirmed. Court reviews rights with DE. Atty Dippolito will make time to speak to DE. Court will reset to 2 p.m. Case recalled at 2:14 p.m. DE is now present, in custody in the courtroom. Atty Dolfi spoke to DE. Defendant wishes to voluntarily waive extradition to Cook County, IL. Court reviews rights with DE. Defendant executes Waiver and court certifies same. Ct finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives extradition. Qualifies for PD services. Atty Dippolito states their office is working on appointment of counsel on other file. Court adjourned at 2:17 p.m.
Signed by DE & RMW on 04/04/22. hml
Warrant from Cook County, IL. arc
